content.question: Which of the following best explains the relationship between GDP per capita and world system theory?

choices.label: There is an uneven distribution of economic development and geographical division of labor in the world.
There is an even distribution of economic development and geographical division of labor in the world.
The countries with the highest GDP are also those with primary economic activities.
The countries with the lowest GDP are those with tertiary economic activities.
The peripheral countries have higher levels of both GDP and primary economic activities.

content.answer: There is an uneven distribution of economic development and geographical division of labor in the world.
